translation.en: Fuck!
Skateboarding has gotten me through
everything I've ever experienced in my life.
People are like, "Are you Lacey Baker?" And I'm like, "Yeah."
It's pretty crazy.
I fully can't even, like, look at footage of me from, like, age 13 to, like, 18.
Lacey Baker was this fucking person that got put together
translation.ko: 레이시 베이커는 그저 주변 세상이 만들어 놓은 허울에 불과했거든요

translation.en: by just the world around me.
translation.ko: 주변 세상이 만들어 놓은 허울에 불과했거든요

translation.en: I had to, like, become this person
and then having all of my dreams riding on that.
translation.ko: 제 모든 꿈도 거기 맞춰져 있었어요

translation.en: How could somebody not choose that?
[sportscaster 1] She's been a dominant force in women's skateboarding

translation.en: for a very long time.
[sportscaster 2] You just don't see anybody else doing what Baker's doing.
[sportscaster 3] Lacey Baker's first ever gold medal.
[sportscaster 4] Seven X Games medals.
Super Crown champion 2016 and 2017.
A legend in women's skateboarding.

translation.en: Oh my God. Okay, challenge accepted.
translation.ko: 대박, 알겠어, 도전해 볼게 "알렉시스 서블론 프로 스케이트보더 / 친구"

translation.en: Have you ever tried that in like a… in like a ramp
translation.ko: "알렉시스 서블론 프로 스케이트보더 / 친구" 그걸 램프에서 시도해 본 적은?

translation.en: where you try to drop in and do a trick on the flatbottom?
translation.ko: 거기서 드롭 인 하고 평지에서 트릭 같은 걸 하는 거지

translation.en: -[chuckling] No. -It's like a recipe for disaster. [laughs]
Okay.
[Baker] I really became obsessed with skating once I started trying to land a kickflip.
translation.ko: 킥 플립 착지를 시도한 뒤부터 보드에 집착하게 됐어요

translation.en: What is happening?
I remember when I finally landed it, my whole world just, like, exploded.
translation.ko: 처음 해냈던 그 순간 온 세상에서 폭발이 일어난 것 같았죠

translation.en: It was so like-- Just that feeling.
And I still get that feeling whenever I learn a new trick.
translation.ko: 새 트릭을 배울 때마다 항상 그런 느낌을 받아요

translation.en: It never goes away.
-[cameraman chuckles] -I fucking did a front crook!
Oh my God! [laughs]
The last time I tried that shit, I was like 16 at Westco Park.
translation.ko: 16살 때 웨스코 파크에서 시도해 본 게 마지막이에요

translation.en: -Just… Whoom! -[cameraman] Yeah.
And then I was like, "Nope. I'm not doing that trick in my life."
-Oh my God. -Yeah.
-What, did you get rub in it? -Yeah.
[sportscaster 1] Skateboarding hits the big stage in Tokyo.
[sportscaster 2] Right. Skateboarding is finally coming to the Olympics.

translation.en: [sportscaster 3] It's a substantial milestone for a sport
translation.ko: 스포츠계에서는 획기적인 사건이 아닐 수 없는데요

translation.en: that 25 years ago was considered anything but mainstream.
translation.ko: 해당 종목은 25년 전만 해도 주류랑은 거리가 멀었거든요

translation.en: -[indistinct chatter] -[gentle music playing]
-How's it going? -Good. Good to see you.
Yeah, you too.
-[skater] How you doing? -Good. How are you?
-You been good? -[Baker] What's up?
So we're here today for the USA National Team announcement.
translation.ko: 오늘은 이 자리에서 미국 국가대표팀을 발표합니다 "조시 프리드버그 미국 스케이트보드 위원회 CEO"

have now provided themselves
an opportunity to get the Olympics in Tokyo 2020.
translation.ko: 2020 도쿄 올림픽에 나갈 수 있게 되었습니다

translation.en: [Baker] It's the first time skateboarding ever has been in the Olympics,
translation.ko: 이번에 스케이트보드가 처음으로 올림픽 종목으로 채택됐잖아요

translation.en: so I want to make it there.
[Jenn] Still can't really believe it to see how far skateboarding has come.
translation.ko: 위상이 얼마나 달라졌는지 아직도 실감이 안 나요 "젠 소토 미국 여자 스케이트보드 국가대표"

translation.en: So this even being an opportunity is insane.
translation.ko: "젠 소토 미국 여자 스케이트보드 국가대표" 이런 기회 자체가 꿈같죠

translation.en: [Josh] Alexis Sablone.
[Alexis] It's the ultimate competition. It's a huge honor.
So yeah, I mean, I think I would regret it forever
translation.ko: 그 자리를 위해 최선을 다하지 않는다면

translation.en: if I didn't try as hard as I could to get there.
But it's weird,
and how it will change skateboarding is a question mark.
translation.ko: 업계에 또 어떤 영향을 미칠진 알 수 없어요

translation.en: [Josh] Next up, Lacey Baker.
Another veteran of the women's contest scene.
[Baker] It's a pretty historic event.
Lacey has been seen putting it down for years.
[Baker] You have to qualify to make it,
so there's gonna be a lot of competing.
It just makes me feel nervous.
So, congratulations.
-Yay. -[audience cheering]
Thanks.
[Josh] …see what you're gonna do.
These are your 2019 USA Skateboarding Women's National Team.
Thank you.
[man] I definitely saw Leo as very talented early on.
translation.ko: 이미 예전부터 리오의 재능이 눈에 띄었어요

translation.en: You could tell that there was… there was a determination there
translation.ko: "토니 호크 프로 스케이트보더" 나이를 뛰어넘는 결의 같은 것이

translation.en: that was beyond his years.
translation.ko: 나이를 뛰어넘는 결의 같은 것이 단번에 느껴졌죠

translation.en: [Alexis] Lee is one of the most skilled people on a skateboard.
translation.ko: 리는 가장 노련한 스케이트보더 중 한 명이에요

translation.en: They do riskier tricks that are, for most of us, like,
translation.ko: 보통 우리보다 훨씬 위험한 트릭을 구사하는데

translation.en: no one can do that first try.
translation.ko: 아무도 첫 시도에 그걸 못 해내요

translation.en: No one's trying to do that in a competition.
[man 2] There's a lot of confidence in the tricks,
but also, there's a lot of technical skill
translation.ko: 기교도 굉장히 뛰어나요 "샘 맥과이어 스케이트보드 사진가"

translation.en: threading tricks together, like, one really powerful flip trick
and then a really hard manual trick.
It's a very specific style of skateboarding,
and it's one that requires crazy perseverance.
[skater] Leo's consistent because he practices a lot.
Seeing him try a trick for two hours,
it's kind of inspiring to see someone skate like that.
translation.ko: 많은 자극을 받죠 "비어트리스 도먼드 프로 스케이트보더"

translation.en: You have to have mind and skill.
translation.ko: 정신력과 기술이 있어야 돼요 "닌 윌리엄스 프로 스케이트보더"

translation.en: Like, you have to be one with your board,
translation.ko: "닌 윌리엄스 프로 스케이트보더" 보드와 하나가 되어야

translation.en: so you can flip it, catch it, land in the manual,
translation.ko: 플립, 캐치 동작도 했다가 매뉴얼로 주행도 하고

translation.en: -and then flip it back out. -[filmer] Whoo!
[Neen] You know? And that takes a lot of mind power. That's like what Lee does.
translation.ko: 그러려면 정신력 소모가 크죠 근데 리는 그걸 해내요

translation.en: [Josh] We're looking forward to watching
translation.ko: "올림픽 여정이 시작되는 곳" 선수들의 스케이팅 수준이

translation.en: their level of skating continue to increase.
translation.ko: 계속 향상되는 모습을 빨리 보고 싶어지네요

translation.en: -I love you. -I love you too, Mom.
-[Josh] On with the guys. -All right. That's for you.
-Yay, another for me. -Yeah, that prize is for Mom right there.
[Leo] It would be really special for a person like me
just to be visibly queer on such a global scale,
translation.ko: 공공연하게 국제 무대에 선다면 굉장히 특별할 거예요

translation.en: but also, being trans,
I feel really out of place, um, in that setting.
Hi.
[Leo] You know what I was thinking about?
Putting a desk in here and making that into a living room.
translation.ko: 여기에 책상을 놓고 저기를 거실로 만들려고

translation.en: [sighs] The never-ending… [chuckles] …home-improvement project.
Well, here's why it's an improvement, because I think it'd be…
translation.ko: 그래서 개조를 하는 거지 그래야 더 좋아지는…

translation.en: [Leo] It's really important to be with someone who, like, really understands you.
translation.ko: 날 이해해 주는 사람과 함께해야 돼요

translation.en: Mel is one of the most kind, loving, and supportive people
I've ever met in my life.
translation.ko: "멜, 난 네게 반했어" 힘이 되는 사람이죠

translation.en: Wait, so we'd get rid of your desk.
Well, my desk is an amplifier with a piece of wood on it.
translation.ko: 내 책상은 위에 나무 딸린 앰프잖아

translation.en: -So, that's not really a desk. -[both chuckle]
-Okay. And then… -[chuckling continues]
[Mel] I'm not involved in the skate world at all,
and until I met Lee, I didn't know anything.
But we had so much fun together.
He was just really easy to get close with immediately.
translation.ko: 금방 친해질 수 있는 타입이었거든요 "멀리사 부에노-워너 여자 친구"

translation.en: [Donna] There. You think you're gonna come?
Yeah, Lee will be there.
[clears throat] I think I get in on… maybe like the first.
Because I have to shoot, um, a skate video thing.
And then… then it's just the contest weekend, so…
[Donna] You're coming in on the 26th--
[Leo] In the industry, I've always been known as Lacey Baker.
translation.ko: 전 이 업계에선 늘 레이시 베이커로 통해요

translation.en: With close friends and family, I prefer to be called Leo.
translation.ko: 친한 친구나 가족이랑 있으면 '리오'로 불리는 게 더 좋아요

translation.en: Not a lot of people know that, especially in the industry,
translation.ko: 이 업계에선 대부분 그 사실을 몰라요

translation.en: just because it's like…
I mean, I don't know why. I… [sighs]
It's a process that I'm going through and like discovering myself and…
translation.ko: 제가 스스로를 알아가는 단계를 거쳐가고 있다지만

translation.en: I don't know. Fuck. I don't know.
The industry is just a big… thing, like, for people to know about that.
translation.ko: 도통 모르겠네요 업계가 워낙 커서일지 그런 게 알려지기 힘든 건지 저로서는 모르겠어요

translation.en: [Mel] When I met Leo, I asked what pronouns he preferred.
translation.ko: 리오를 만났을 때 어떤 젠더 대명사가 좋냐고 물었죠

translation.en: And he kind of nervously responded quickly, like, "Uh, she/her is fine."
translation.ko: 그랬더니 초조한 기색으로 빠르게 답하더군요 '여자로 불러도 상관없어'

translation.en: He was like, "No one's ever asked me that before."
[Leo] Like, I just was, like, avoidant.
But literally, the next day, it was like, "Actually…"
She was just like, "Yeah, I'm queer. I get it."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말해 줬어요 '나 퀴어거든, 난 이해해'

translation.en: To have space to explore those things about myself
translation.ko: 나 자신을 탐구할 수 있는 그런 우주가 있고

translation.en: alongside somebody who, like, really understands,
it was like immediate freedom.
[Mel] There was one night where he opened up
translation.ko: 어느 날 밤은 리가 제게 터놓고 모든 걸 쏟아낸 적이 있어요

translation.en: and just poured everything out to me…
translation.ko: 리가 제게 터놓고 모든 걸 쏟아낸 적이 있어요

translation.en: …telling me that he was trans and he's known for a really long time
translation.ko: 자기가 트랜스젠더고 예전부터 그 사실을 알고 있었지만

translation.en: but just sort of, like, pushed it down.
It would be impossible for him to come out because of his career.
translation.ko: 리 커리어를 생각하면 커밍아웃도 힘들 거예요 "레이시!"

translation.en: And he has to choose between being his authentic self
translation.ko: 선택해야 한대요 "더 베릭스 여자부" 진정한 자아와 평생을 쏟아부은 커리어 중에서요

translation.en: and his career that he's worked so hard for.
translation.ko: 진정한 자아와 평생을 쏟아부은 커리어 중에서요

translation.en: [Leo] It got to a point for me where I felt like I'm living a split life.
I know in what space I'm gonna be Lacey and when I can just be me.
translation.ko: '레이시'가 되어야 하는 곳과 그냥 나로 있을 수 있는 곳이 갈리니까요

translation.en: [producer] You afraid of some sort of backlash?
[cameraman] Smile for us, sweet ladies.
[cameraman] Right there. Right there.
Nice. Oh, fix the jacket so I can see the Nike.
Real quick, for your team.
-Team official headshot right there. -[camera beeping]
Right. You work it.
[Alexis] Lee is a good friend of mine that I've known for years
translation.ko: 리는 오랫동안 알고 지내온 소중한 친구지만

translation.en: but is also internationally known and respected as someone else.
translation.ko: 전 세계에는 다른 이름으로 알려져 있어요

translation.en: So it's confusing if I'm talking about "Lee" and "he."
translation.ko: 그래서 리를 '그'라고 지칭하면 좀 혼란스러울 때가 있어요

translation.en: I don't want them to, like, miss out on the credit
of, like… [chuckles] …their reputation, basically.
-Turn around. -[camera shutter clicks]
-[Leo] Sick. -[producer] All right, girls. Yes, girls.
All right. Right there.
[Alexis] I can't really imagine how it feels for Lee.
translation.ko: 리는 어떤 기분일지 상상이 안 가요

translation.en: I mean, even for me, it's just like,
"Okay, ladies." Like, it doesn't fit what you're doing.
translation.ko: '좋아요, 숙녀분들'이라고 하면 나랑은 안 맞는 표현인데 싶죠

translation.en: It feels like you're… been put in this category,
the ladies category. You're like, "No, we're just skateboarders."
-[photographer] Give me some… Work it. -[camera shutter clicks]
I don't want to work it. [chuckles]
[photographer] AZ, can you make her smile? Someone make her smile.
translation.ko: AZ, 이분 웃게 해줘 누구라도 좋으니까 도와줘요

translation.en: -Come on, make her smile. -[producer] Yes!
[Leo] So, right now, there's a lot of emphasis on the Olympics.
And that is so far off from where skateboarding came from.
[skater] Slow down! Slow down!
[Alexis] When I started skating in the '90s,
if you told somebody
that skateboarding was gonna be in the Olympics right now,
translation.ko: 스케이트보드가 30년 뒤 올림픽 종목이 될 거라고 했다간

translation.en: they would laugh in your face and walk away, you know?
translation.ko: 다들 제 면전에서 절 비웃었을 거예요

translation.en: You didn't even call yourself an athlete.
Skateboarding was not a sport. It's like the anti-jock.
translation.ko: 스케이트보드는 스포츠라기보다 오히려 그 반대 같았거든요

translation.en: It's for everybody. It's a lot more than how it's gonna appear on TV.
translation.ko: 모두를 위한 활동이었고 TV에 비치는 것보다 의미가 컸죠

translation.en: [Leo] We were skating because we love it so much…
translation.ko: 저희는 스케이트보드가 너무 좋아서 탄 거예요

translation.en: …not to win contests.
[scoffs] Getting… getting schooled by, like, a 15-year-old.
translation.ko: 15살짜리한테 제대로 배웠네 "앨릭스 화이트 전직 프로 스케이트보더"

translation.en: That time period in our lives, when we were all young,
translation.ko: "앨릭스 화이트 전직 프로 스케이트보더" 우리 모두 어리고

translation.en: and there was no money in it,
and we were just skateboarding 'cause we loved it was super special.
translation.ko: 좋아해 마지않던 스케이트보드를 타던 시절은 참 특별했죠

translation.en: [Lisa] What do you think of that?
-Wonderful. Yeah. -[Leo] Pretty good?
-Very good. They're experts. -[Leo chuckles]
I thought it was only for boys, you know, but I never saw girls doing it.
translation.ko: 남자만 하는 건 줄 알았는데 여자가 하는 건 처음 봐요

translation.en: That was it. I mean, we're just like little skaters.
-[Leo] What are you doing? -[speaks indistinctly]
It's funny because I didn't speak English.
translation.ko: "레티시아 부포니 프로 스케이트보더" 웃겼어요 제가 영어를 전혀 몰랐거든요

translation.en: And then, the only way we could communicate
translation.ko: 우리가 소통할 수 있는 유일한 방법은

So that's… that's how we became friends.
-[Leo] So, what are you doing, Vanessa? -Some fucking shit, dude.
translation.ko: 뭐 하는 거야, 버네사? 미친 짓 한번 해보려고

translation.en: Our generation was just all about going out and skating and learning tricks.

translation.en: -[Leo] Yes! -[clapping, whistles]
[Vanessa] And now there's an objective.
And with the Olympics, it's like, "Gold."
So, are you doing two decimal, or is it on a one to ten?
translation.ko: 그럼 10점 구간이 두 번인 건가요? 아니면 1점에서 10점까지예요?

translation.en: Um, for the park, it will be, uh, zero to a hundred.
translation.ko: "2019 미국 전국 선수권 첫 올림픽 예선" 파크는 0에서 100점이에요

translation.en: -Okay, so… -Two decimals.
-[Josh] Street should be one decimal. -[Vanessa] One to ten, yeah.
translation.ko: - 스트리트는 한 번이고요 - 한 번, 알겠어요

translation.en: That's rad, though.
It breaks down all the logistics literally right there underneath, like, each rider.
translation.ko: 모든 라이더의 계획에 전면 수정이 필요하겠어요

translation.en: You guys know the rules for the trick counting?
-If you're in a transition, it counts. -[skater] Yeah.
Um, if you haven't tapped your tail on a street trick, it doesn't count.
translation.ko: 스트리트 트릭 시 테일을 안 건드리면 무효가 돼요

translation.en: Olympics is honestly a language
that I don't think any of us know as skateboarders.
That makes our job really hard,
because it's like, you have a technical trick

translation.ko: 정말이지 끝내주는 발재간도 부릴 줄 아는데

translation.en: You know what I mean? So it's like, how do they measure up?
You need to be pushing boundaries of skateboarding and what is possible.
[Josh] Thank you guys for coming out. Super proud to see where we're headed
in this road to Tokyo 2020.
At its core, skateboarding is so difficult… [chuckles]
…that anyone that can do it gets the respect.
Today, you can pick up a basketball, and you can make a hoop.
translation.ko: 오늘 농구공을 처음 들어도 골대에 넣을 수도 있잖아요

translation.en: I guarantee you would not be able to ollie in one day.
They should be Olympians. They should have gold medals.
translation.ko: 진작 올림픽에 나가서 금메달을 땄어야 돼요

translation.en: The narrative I hate is that we're lucky to be there.
translation.ko: 우리가 거기 가서 다행이란 말이 정말 듣기 싫어요

translation.en: Like, pfft. "You're lucky to have us there."
Really solid. Had a great mix. Skated the whole course.
translation.ko: 정말 알찹니다, 멋진 콤비네이션! 온 경기장을 휩쓸었네요

translation.en: She got some flip tricks, skated the rails.
The whole kit and caboodle.
-How's that? -Good.
[Mimi] The stakes are higher than they've ever been.
translation.ko: "미미 눕 미국 여자 팀 매니저" 그 어느 때보다 많은 게 걸려 있어요

translation.en: Yeah!
[Mimi] The competition is stronger than it's ever been.
Ultimately, who has the best overall top scores stays on the team.
translation.ko: 최종적으로 가장 높은 점수를 받은 사람이 팀에 남게 돼요

translation.en: [man in audience] Yeah. What's up, boy?
I really can't, like, afford in this moment
to, like, get surgery and not be able to skate, so…
translation.ko: 수술을 받거나 보드를 못 타게 되기라도 하면…

translation.en: They're being asked to do something that's never been done before.
translation.ko: 전혀 해보지 못한 걸 요구받고 있죠

translation.en: It's like we used to just have these contests that are just spread out
maybe three, four times a year, you know?
And now we have a set schedule that's one back-to-back contest.
translation.ko: 이번에 스케줄이 나왔는데 정말 빼곡하게 일정이 잡혀 있어요

translation.en: Even when you're skating these contests,
you still have to focus on working out, physical therapy. Everything is work.
translation.ko: 계속 운동이나 물리치료에도 집중해야 하고요 매 순간이 일인 거죠

translation.en: [Mimi] It's a lot to adjust to.
Even more so for the people that have been in this for a while.
translation.ko: 오랫동안 이 일을 해온 사람들은 특히 더 그렇죠

translation.en: [Leo sighs] Definitely getting through this year of competition
is just gonna be like,
all of my focus and energy on, like, my physical strength,
translation.ko: 내 모든 체력과 에너지을 쏟아부어야 해요

translation.en: my mental health, and, like, my ability to skate.
The impact of making it to the Olympics would be pretty big,
translation.ko: 올림픽에 출전하게 되면 정말이지 엄청날 거예요

translation.en: and I'm in a position where I could potentially make it there.
-Yeah! -Yes!
-And that is time right there. -Amazing.
[Mimi] Lee is a pioneer in the space.
Hands down, Lee earned this spot.
[Vanessa] Lee is one of the hardest-working people that I know.
translation.ko: 리는 제가 아는 이들 중 가장 노력하는 사람이에요

translation.en: I would love to see…
them get there.
I think that they're totally capable of doing it.
The question is, is their heart in it? You know what I mean?
[Leo] Things occurred to me very late,
which is surprising, considering that I can look back on that
translation.ko: 과거를 되돌아보면 늘 그랬던 것 같은데

translation.en: and be like, "Oh yeah, all that was there."
And when I was younger, I remember just being like,
"No, like, I'm a boy." It's like I knew that
translation.ko: 저 스스로를 남자라고 말했거든요 이미 알았던 거죠

translation.en: and then it got lost in the fucking ether of, like, capitalism.
translation.ko: 그래놓곤 자본주의에 취해 잊고 있었던 거예요

translation.en: [Sam] Lee, for years, was the star of women's skating.
translation.ko: "2004년 갤러즈 스케이트 잼" 리는 오랫동안 여자 스케이트보드의 스타였어요

translation.en: Anything that was being said about Lee, it was like, "Female, female, female."
And they just, like, branded him.
[Leo] Lacey Baker, long blond hair.
They just associated me with that,
like that was some kind of trademark or something,
but it's never what I wanted.
translation.ko: 전 한 번도 원한 적 없었는데도요

translation.en: I remember being in meetings, it was like a conversation amongst adults,
translation.ko: 한번은 회의에 참석해서 어른들 사이에 껴 있었는데

translation.en: of them being like, "All the way down to, like, the name."
"Lacey Baker. It's so marketable."
[girl] Hard flip.
[Leo] "Well, you're on the girls' team. You have to wear girls' clothes."
translation.ko: '넌 여자 팀이야 여자 옷을 입어야 한다'

translation.en: So, it was lots of pressure to dress more feminine,
translation.ko: 여성스러운 옷을 입어야 한다는 부담감이 컸고

translation.en: and that's when things started getting super uncomfortable.
[Sam] I think it was something every company wanted him to do.
"Dress this way. Be this way. You're a skater and a punk,
translation.ko: '이렇게 입어, 이렇게 행동해 넌 보드를 타는 불량아지만'

translation.en: but, like, don't be that weird."
I would pay to, like, hear someone be like,
"So here's the girl we're thinking you should be."
[Leo] People were just seeing me as marketable,
wearing all these women's clothes to sell a product.
translation.ko: 물건을 팔기 위해 여자 옷을 입혔어요

translation.en: They're just like, "Oh, just change this one thing about yourself."
translation.ko: '네 원래 모습에서 한 가지만 바꾸면 돼'

translation.en: "Just change this one thing." And I'm like,
"If I change that, then I level up."
And I'm just like, "This means I get to skate."
translation.ko: '보드를 탈 수 있는 거구나' 그렇게 믿었단 말이죠

translation.en: I mean, I was so young. How could I even see?
translation.ko: 전 너무 어렸거든요 어떻게 세상 물정을 알았겠어요?

translation.en: -[Leo] What are you doing? -[Mel] Putting socks on.
Thinking about stealing one of your shirts.
[Leo] Okay, go ahead.
Maybe this one. [Leo] That one's dirty, but you can wear it.
translation.ko: - 이거로 할까 - 안 빨았는데 입어도 상관없어

translation.en: [Mel] When he's at home, he's started to feel this acceptance
translation.ko: 리는 집에 오면 포용을 느끼면서 안도해요

translation.en: within the queer community, like, "I can be who I am,"
and then goes to work
or goes to shoot a video or travel to do a contest or whatever,
translation.ko: 영상을 찍거나 대회 때문에 출장을 갔을 때

translation.en: -and there's so much emphasis… -[cheering]
…on the fact that he's a "female" skater.
And for someone's profession to focus around what your gender is,
and you're not that gender, that's crazy.
translation.ko: 내 성 정체성은 다르다니 미치고 팔짝 뛸 노릇이죠

translation.en: He's like, "I've worked my whole to get here."
translation.ko: 리는 여기까지 오려고 최선을 다했다고 말해요

translation.en: "I'm finally able to support myself doing what I love,
translation.ko: 좋아하는 걸 좇는 나 자신을 응원하게 됐는데

translation.en: and I can't throw it away because I need to come out as trans."
translation.ko: 트랜스 커밍아웃 때문에 그걸 다 내칠 수는 없대요

translation.en: To see him go through this is…
I can't do anything to fix it, and that, I think, is the hardest part.
translation.ko: 제가 아무것도 해줄 수 없다는 게 제일 힘들죠

translation.en: [Leo] Right now, I'm on this journey of what's gonna work for me.
translation.ko: 지금은 나한테 뭐가 맞는지 차차 알아보는 중이에요

translation.en: I'm trying to be comfortable in my body.
I'm 27 now, and it's been a long process to even get to this place,
translation.ko: 이제 27살이고 여기까지 오는 것도 오래 걸렸어요

translation.en: but I'm just at the beginning of the road still.
translation.ko: 하지만 제 여정은 이제 막 시작된 거예요

translation.en: If I was living a different life,
I might just transition and move to a new city
and live happily ever after.
But I'm in a space where I have to have a conversation about it with the world,
translation.ko: 하지만 저에 대해 설명해야 하는 삶을 살고 있어요 "SLS 월드 챔피언 슈퍼 크라운"

translation.en: and I don't want to.
This is my high school right here.
When we had half days, we would skate behind this Albertsons.
translation.ko: 우리 학교 일찍 끝나는 날이면 슈퍼마켓 뒤에서 보드 탔었잖아

translation.en: There's just, like, flat ground around there.
We'd go and, like, skate after school sometimes.
translation.ko: 수업 끝나면 종종 가서 보드를 타곤 했어

translation.en: [Vanessa] Adolescence and skateboarding is, like, all about loading docks.
-Dude, yeah. Kickflip everything. -[Vanessa] Let me see what I can…
translation.ko: - 맞아, 뭐든 뒤집을 수 있어 - 예를 들면 이런 거야

translation.en: What's the highest thing that I can jump off of?
translation.ko: 뛰어내릴 땐 가능한 가장 높은 곳을 찾다가

translation.en: Now it's, what's the lowest thing that I can skate?
translation.ko: 보드를 탈 때는 또 가장 낮은 곳으로 이동하잖아

translation.en: [Leo] Yeah, definitely.
Hello?
-Hey, Mom. -[Donna] Hi!
-[Leo] Hi, Mama. -Hi.
-[Vanessa] Smells like home. -How are you?
-[Vanessa] Hi. How are you doing? -I'm good. How are you?
Oh, I love you so much.
-[Vanessa] Good to see you. -[Donna] I missed you.
translation.ko: - 얼굴 보니까 너무 좋다 - 보고 싶었어요

translation.en: [Vanessa] Well, it looks great in here, Ma.
[Leo] Oh my God. There's so much stuff in here. Oh my God!
translation.ko: 여기 뭐가 엄청 많은데 이럴 수가!

translation.en: -I can't believe this, dude. -[Vanessa] Oh my--
-Who in the… -I've known you this long.
-[Vanessa] Babies. -[Leo] Dude, look at this poster.
translation.ko: - 완전 아기들이네 - 이 포스터 좀 봐

translation.en: [Donna] That was your first poster you were ever put on.
"Kickflips and fish sticks." Like, what is that? [chuckles]
translation.ko: '킥 플립과 피시 스틱' 그게 대체 뭔데?

translation.en: These are the shoes that Lacey was wearing
when she made it into the semis at the Tampa Am in 2008.
-Wait, those are sick-ass shoes. -My mom--
Every time I heard people referring to him as Lee,
I'm just like, "Why can't I do that?" It just… I want to do it so bad.
translation.ko: 솔직히 저도 그렇게 부르고 싶어요, 정말로요!

translation.en: -That is Evan. -[Leo] Oh my God, I need that.
Because I know she's a boy.
He's a boy.
I will get it. I will.
Who made this? Mom, who made this?
-I have no idea. -It is elaborate.
[Leo] Someone made a serious scrapbook.
translation.ko: 누가 엄청 정성 들여 스크랩북을 만들었네

translation.en: Look what it says on the back. -Skateboard Princess. -Wow.
Dude. I should change my Instagram handle to this.
translation.ko: 와, 내 인스타그램 ID 이걸로 바꿔야겠어

translation.en: [Vanessa] Yes.
Welcome to Northview High School's Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony.
translation.ko: 노스뷰 고교 명예의 전당 입성식에 잘 오셨습니다

translation.en: The first inductee epitomizes a Hall of Fame candidate.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 입성자는 그야말로 명예의 전당에 걸맞은 분이죠

translation.en: USA Skateboarding National Team member for the 2020 Olympics.
Her accomplishments are staggering.
[Leo] What's up? Yeah.
-Thanks for having me. How you doing? -I'm doing well.
-Cool. Nice to see you. -Congratulations on everything.
Thanks so much.
We're lucky. We don't have a lot of, uh, stand-out females,
translation.ko: 우린 운도 좋지 뛰어난 여학생은 많이 없었는데

translation.en: but the two we have… [exhales] …you and Tatiana…
-Yeah. -Yeah.
It's nice to have two world-class athletes around.
translation.ko: 세계 정상급 선수가 둘이나 있다니 참 좋구나

translation.en: -Cool, man, thanks. -Yeah. Have fun in the Olympics.
-[Donna] That was awkward. -[chuckles]
I'm like, "Yeah…"
It's just super awkward to be referred to as female.
translation.ko: 여자라고 불리는 게 그냥 너무 어색해서

translation.en: It just feels really weird. What do you think is in here?
translation.ko: 기분이 좀 이상하네 여기 뭐가 들었을까?

translation.en: [Leo] Oh my God. So good to see you guys.
-[man] I know. -Check it out. Look at you.
[laughing] Oh fuck. That's so crazy.
translation.ko: "도노본 피스코포 폰샵 스케이트 운영" 미친, 말도 안 돼

translation.en: Aw, look how cute you were.
You still are, but like, you were such a little cutie.
translation.ko: 여전히 귀엽긴 한데 이때는 진짜 귀염둥이였어

translation.en: Well, the shop wouldn't be anything if it wasn't for the actual skateboarders,
and that's been a part of it.
All the kids come in to hang out and stuff
'cause there's, like, not many places to be around here in Covina.
translation.ko: 코비나에 놀 곳이 원체 많이 없잖아

translation.en: -Staying out of trouble's kind of hard. -Yeah.
So this place gives you, like, more of a home,
'cause us kids that skateboard come from broken homes, right?
translation.ko: 보드를 타는 아이들은 대개 결손 가정 출신들이니까

translation.en: It's just like our family.
Yeah. [chuckles] Yeah.
[Donovon] Trying to make the most of it.
That was always the thing about skateboarding.
We would be able to go skate. We could forget about all the troubles we already have at home.
translation.ko: 보드를 타러 가면 집 일은 다 잊을 수 있어요

translation.en: [Leo] The Covina skateboarding community,
that's what saved my life.
[Donna] There was a lot of great times, and there was some good times,
but there was some bad times. There was some… …heartbreak along the way.
translation.ko: 안 좋은 시기도 있었거든요 마음이 아팠던 때가 있었죠

translation.en: I say I came out of the 1980s
with three beautiful children and an addiction to meth.
translation.ko: 예쁜 세 아이를 낳았으며 마약 중독자였어요

translation.en: My mom and dad met in rehab. It's where I was conceived.
translation.ko: 부모님은 재활원에서 만났어요 거기서 제가 생겼죠

translation.en: [Donna] When I had Lacey, I was in treatment.
translation.ko: 레이시를 가졌을 때는 한창 치료 중이었어요

translation.en: And I got home, and not long after, I relapsed.
translation.ko: 집에 왔는데 얼마 안 가 재발했어요

translation.en: And then, um,
my sister had locked the door,
and they said, "You can't have your babies."
translation.ko: 전 아이를 키워선 안 된다고 했어요

translation.en: And I could hear Lacey behind the door, crying for me.
translation.ko: 문 뒤에서 레이시가 절 찾으며 우는 소리가 들렸죠

translation.en: Calling, "Mommy, Mommy." Banging on the door.
I mean, how can I get that out of my head, ever?
[Leo] I just feel like I missed out on so much time with my family.
translation.ko: 가족과 함께할 시간을 많이 놓친 것 같아요

translation.en: My dad was a rock star in bands and very talented.
translation.ko: 아버지는 록 밴드의 멤버였고 재능도 뛰어났어요

translation.en: Also, he was a junkie.
So, you know, it was a rocky road.
It cut his life short. I mean, he died, like, young.
[Donna] End up having to put them through foster care.
translation.ko: 결국 애들을 위탁 가정에 보낼 수밖에 없었어요

translation.en: [Leo] I think I was three years old,
and I'd stand outside and watch my two foster brothers skate.
translation.ko: 밖에 서서 수양 형제들 둘이 보드 타는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: I would skate all the time and try to learn how to kickflip.
translation.ko: 저도 항상 보드를 타며 킥 플립을 배웠죠

translation.en: I love this photo.
[Donna] Which one is that?
Where it's my third birthday and you're there standing next to me.
translation.ko: 제 세 번째 생일날 사진요 엄마는 내 옆에 서 있네요

translation.en: Helping you blow out the candles?
[Leo] Yeah, and I'm like so little.
-How cute am I? -Teeny tiny.
-You were cute. -[chuckles]
I know.
My mom tried her absolute best to, like, get her shit together,
and she did, you know?
Camera real quick, Mom! Ah!
[Donna] I'm videoing, taping, or whatever.
My mom got us back, and so I was, like, living at home.
translation.ko: 엄마가 우릴 다시 데려와서 집에서 살게 됐어요

translation.en: Adjust.
We hardly had anything, but, you know, she kept me skating
translation.ko: 가진 건 거의 없었지만 계속 보드를 타게 해줬어요 제가 행복해했으니까요

translation.en: because it made me happy.
translation.ko: 계속 보드를 타게 해줬어요 제가 행복해했으니까요

translation.en: [announcer] She's got that one wired.
[Leo] My mom would drive me to competitions once a month.
translation.ko: 한 달에 한 번씩 절 대회에 데려다주곤 하셨어요

translation.en: -That was a majority of my teen years. -[Donna cheers] Lacey!
[Leo] Then I got sponsored.
-Oh wow. -These are all of the T-shirts.
[Leo] Oh yeah, from… My mom collected all the T-shirts
from the Damn Am and Tampa Am series anytime we'd go.
translation.ko: '탬파 앰' 시리즈 셔츠는 엄마가 다 모아둔 거죠?

translation.en: This you got at a Super Girl, and you were like,
translation.ko: 이건 '슈퍼 걸'에서 받은 건데 네가 그랬지

translation.en: "Yeah, no. I'm never gonna rock that stuff."
[Donna] Like, nine months out of the year, we were on an airplane.
It was hard having the responsibility sometime as being manager.
translation.ko: 매니저로서 책임이 따르는 게 힘들 때도 있었어요

translation.en: Something would not go right over the weekend, and I'd get home and get a phone call.
translation.ko: 주말에 일이 꼬이면 이런 전화도 많이 받았죠

translation.en: Like, "Why wasn't she wearing this and didn't have this on?"
And that's where, I think, a lot of the tension came
translation.ko: 그래서 나도 모르게 압박을 받았던 거죠

translation.en: because I did find myself making sure,
"Okay. You got stickers, right? You got your T-shirts, right? Got this?"
And, God, I didn't wanna be that person.
I didn't wanna be that mom.
Because Ant and I went that day. We were all taking photos of you guys.
translation.ko: 그날 앤트랑 같이 가서 너희 사진을 찍어주고 있었어

translation.en: [Leo] I had my dreams that I wanted to fulfill,
but there was also my financial situation at home, like…
My mom wasn't exactly thriving.
She was, like, injured and, like, on workman's comp and shit.
translation.ko: 다쳐서 산재 보험 문제에 이것저것 복잡했죠

translation.en: And so, like, a lot of the income was, like, on my skating.
First big, grown-up trip.
[Leo] In 2008, at the Maloof Money Cup, I won $25,000.
That's what we lived on.
[Alex] If Leo had a choice when they were younger,
they would have never entered all these contests,
translation.ko: 선택권이 있었다면 대회 참가를 안 했을 거예요

translation.en: but, up until recently, there wasn't an option
translation.ko: 하지만 얼마 전까지만 해도 선택의 여지가 없었어요

translation.en: for women skateboarders to have a career outside of competition.
translation.ko: 여성 스케이트보더들은 커리어를 쌓을 다른 방도가 없었죠

translation.en: [Leo] No brands really took girls skating seriously for many years.
translation.ko: 여자 스케이트보더들은 스포츠 브랜드에 오랫동안 찬밥 신세였어요

translation.en: So, it was like, if I win the one competition a year…

translation.en: I learned a lot through those years of struggle.
translation.ko: 그동안 힘들었지만 정말 많은 걸 배웠어요

translation.en: You know, like the hard work ultimately paid off.
People were just like, "Yeah, you're still skating and ripping."
translation.ko: 제가 계속 보드를 타는 게 멋지게 보였나 봐요

translation.en: And so, people started to be like, "Oh, like, yeah, we wanna invest in that."
And now there's just like a clearing for so many new possibilities
translation.ko: 이전 삶에서는 누리지 못했던 수많은 기회의 문이

translation.en: that just I did not have in that life I was living.
Back in first place.
[Leo] And sitting there watching the Olympics
and feeling absolutely fucking elated that I'm not there.
translation.ko: 제가 그 무대에 없어서 기분이 날아갈 것 같은 거예요

translation.en: It's like, I know what's best for me,
and I think I knew it all along.
Even when I was, like, really, really young.
[Stephen] Leo's done a really good job of being visible for a lot of people.
translation.ko: 리오는 대중들의 눈에 띄며 아주 영리한 행보를 보여왔어요

translation.en: That's what real representation is,
Is people feeling like they have permission to be themselves.
translation.ko: 자기 자신으로 있어도 된다고 메시지를 전달하잖아요

translation.en: I'm getting a pro shoe from Nike.
-[Donna] A pro shoe? Like-- -[Leo] Like my own model.
You know…
-[Donna] I'm so proud of you. -[Leo chuckles]
Oh my God. Leo.
[Stephen] Hello?
Hi.
-[Leo] Hi. -Oh, hello, puppy.
-We need stickers. -[chuckles] Let's get stickers.
[Stephen] I feel like we should do only Glue stickers, whatever--
[Leo] Yeah, for sure.
[Leo] The way that I felt for a long time about my pre-sponsored self…
translation.ko: 오래전 후원을 받기 전 제 모습을 떠올려보면

translation.en: [Stephen] Gonna look sick.
[Leo] …it's like I'm just now getting back in touch with that person.
There's no more, uh…
like, facade.
[Stephen] Skating, at this point, is a multibillion-dollar industry,
translation.ko: 스케이트보드는 이제 수십억 달러 규모의 산업이 됐어

translation.en: and you can count on two hands the amount of, like, professionals
translation.ko: 성 정체성이 다른 프로도 10명 이상이나 되고

translation.en: who are, like, gay, queer, trans, or even, like, women also, you know?
translation.ko: 동성애자, 퀴어, 트랜스에 심지어 여자도 있고

translation.en: -It's crazy. -[Leo] You can, like, name them all.
[Cher] Epic Glue party.
It's about to start.
-[Cher] Oh my God. -[both chuckle]
[Leo] All right, kickflip.
All right. Whoever gets the first kickflip gets a board,
translation.ko: - 이제 킥 플립! - 좋습니다 첫 킥 플립을 성공시켜 보세요

translation.en: but you have to do it in 30 seconds.
[Stephen] All right, we got a winner.
I really look up to Leo, honestly.
Ju, like, the freedom of doing whatever you want
and being whoever you want. Not being afraid to show your true self.
Dude, they're doing everything. Doing everything they should be doing.
translation.ko: 그렇잖아요, 필요한 모든 걸 빠짐없이 하고 있으니까

translation.en: [Sam] I think Lee's legacy will be bringing some much-needed authenticity to skating.
translation.ko: 리의 유산은 스케이트보드 업계에 진정성의 씨앗이 될 거예요

translation.en: [Leo] Okay, that's great. Right here. Whoa, turn around.
Lee becoming so popular and famous and everything just shattered everything.
translation.ko: 리는 유명해지면서 이전에 있던 모든 틀을 깨부쉈어요

translation.en: [Leo] I know what it's like
to, like, not have anyone to look up to.
translation.ko: 우러러볼 사람이 없다는 게 어떤 건지

translation.en: But there's trans people everywhere,
which is something I wish that I knew as a kid.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 이걸 알았다면 얼마나 좋았을까요

translation.en: Everything leading up to right now
is one version of being trans,
but there are so many versions of it.
I don't have the answers.
I only have, like, my answers that I've gotten so far.
translation.ko: 온갖 시행착오로 저한테 맞는 답만 찾았을 뿐이죠

translation.en: I just think it's really important to have compassion for yourself.
translation.ko: 스스로에 대한 연민을 갖는 게 중요하다고 생각해요

translation.en: And that, like, every iteration of yourself counts.
translation.ko: 수없이 질문을 던지며 답을 찾아야 하죠

translation.en: I'm just, like, one fucking person…
and I just happen to be trans.
And I think that, l just existing should be enough.
At the end of the day, I'm just a fucking skater, so, like,
translation.ko: 제일 중요한 건 이거죠 난 스케이트보더라는 것

translation.en: I just gonna skate. [chuckles]
And, like, enjoy it.
Because it's like, life is so brief, so I don't wanna waste any more time.
translation.ko: 인생이 너무나도 짧거든요 더는 시간을 허비하기 싫어요
